body:
Comment 2 by **pierre@gwan.ch**: 
Thank you for your reply.

Yes, it works from the command-line (hence my question of invoking 'go build' from a
program). 

After I sent my question I have used 'sudo ./myprog':

1. I had to use "/usr/local/go/bin/go" because the "system-wide" /etc/environment is
ignored by "sudo"

2. here the hello executable was generated as expected

3. After changing the "x" flag of the hello executable, it was running fine.

So the problem is that without sudo "go build" can't use the "/tmp" directory to compile
hello.go.

How can my program invoke "go build" without sudo?

This program is run by the logged user who is part of the 'root' group and should
normally iheritate the user credentials. I am lost and will gladly welcome help.

Please find attached the strace (edited to remove the huge irrelevant portions).
Attachments: 1. go.txt (13539 bytes)
